mltgeneration
  • Reference

Run the iteration process to select the best scalars for the stage 1 and 2 iterations.

Run scalar selection process within the stage 1 and 2 iteration processes. Test x equally-spaced scalar values. After finding the closest fit to target value, re-center on the best scalar value and redefine the scalar value window to 4 times the step-size of the current-run (narrowing the window). Then, run another iteration on new scalar values. Repeat for num_iterations times.

select_scalars(input, hiv_type, num_iterations, num_scalars, target_var,
  adjustment_function)

Arguments

input

data.table to be processed. Contains all variables needed in the given adjustment_function, along with min_scalar and max_scalar variables. If hiv_type == "hiv_free_ZAF", must also include scalar_cap variable.
hiv_type

character, name of HIV processing type used for scalar iteration. Used to determine whether to apply caps on scalar values
num_iterations

numeric, the number of time select_scalars should create a new set of scalars and find an optimal scalar value within the set
num_scalars

numeric, the number of values to generate and test within each scalar_set
target_var

character, name of variable that is being compared to (target variable)
adjustment_function

numeric whole number, the number of scalar values to be tested within each iteration

Value

numeric value representing the optimal scalar given the input and other argument definitions

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Value
